alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 8:46PM MDT until August 26 at 6:45AM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River near Artesia 6E affecting Eddy County. For the Pecos River...including Artesia 6E, Carlsbad 9NW (Damsite 3), Carlsbad 2E, below Dark Canyon, Malaga 3ESE, Malaga 10S, Girvin 3NNW, Sheffield 3ESE, Rio Penasco Dayton 2WNW, Rocky Arroyo Lakewood 7S, Dark Canyon Carlsbad, Black River Malaga 5W, Delaware River Red Bluff 11NW, Independence Creek Sheffield 18SSE...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecos River near Artesia 6E. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, the river reaches bankfull. Overbank flooding occurs about 1/2 mile upstream from the gage and spreads onto the flood plain. As a result, river width increases to approximately 1 mile in some reaches. Minor flooding of low-lying areas occurs, but no significant damage is expected. At 12.5 feet, the river reaches minor flood stage. Structures at Wilbank Trucking, Inc., located approximately 1/4 mile east of the gage, begin to flood. At 13.5 feet, the river reaches the floor of the instrument shelter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 12.8 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 07/18/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Wed Wed Wed Wed Location Stg Stg Day/Time 12am 6am 12pm 6pm Pecos River Artesia 6E 12.5 8.0 Tue 8pm 8.1 9.7 10.7 11.6 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 845 AM MDT.
